meanings.definition: A rib in Gothic vaulting that does not spring from the springing line of the vault
meanings.sent1: The lierne added intricate details to the vaulted ceiling.
meanings.sent2: Architects used liernes to enhance the beauty of the cathedral's architecture.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel ran along the lierne, pretending it was a tightrope.
meanings.sent4: The lierne intertwined with the other ribs like a dance in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The lierne curved gracefully, resembling the branches of a tree reaching towards the sky.

meanings.definition: A type of medieval vaulting rib that connects the intersections of other ribs
meanings.sent1: The lierne elegantly linked the different parts of the vaulted ceiling.
meanings.sent2: Medieval architects used liernes to create stunning patterns in their designs.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten jumped from lierne to lierne, exploring the ancient castle.
meanings.sent4: The lierne intertwined with the other ribs like a spider weaving its web.
meanings.sent5: The lierne stood out, like a golden thread weaving through a tapestry of stone.
